intro: Pentaceras australe, commonly known as the southern star-leaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Pentaceras australe is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
